Just got back from a great brunch at Inspiration Kitchen and I wanted to spread the word.  Inspiration has great food that is well prepared and served at affordable prices.  The space is beautiful, very bright and clean with exposed brick and wood beams.  I had the chicken and waffles with cayenne syrup. A little more indulgent than my usual brunch fare, but well worth the extra calories.  My wife had the catfish po-boy, which was excellent.  Our server, Jeffrey was friendly and attentive. Can't wait to go back and try some of the breakfast items. They had an omelet with fried green tomatos and pimento cheese that looked really good. The atmosphere is very relaxed and it's BYOB. The party next to us brought their own champagne for some mimosas, which is a really great way to keep costs down at brunch.

Two words: Quinoa Burger.  OMG. We went here for brunch with some friends last weekend and had a great time. Everyone loved their food and I knew from reading up on some reviews that the quinoa burger came highly recommended. It did not disappoint. We had a great leisurely meal and we felt the service was top-notch. Although, I am not sure why they were out of coffee mugs the day we went (we had to have paper cups instead)-but other than that, everything was fantastic. Can't wait to go back and try more dishes!

I highly enjoyed this!  We went for Open House Chicago (nice tour of the facilities and all the green initiatives, including solar power and sustainable lighting).  Having been to the Uptown location, which wasn't especially memorable, I wasn't sure what to expect here.  IT. WAS. DELICIOUS. Usually not one to order the same thing as my tablemates (it's more fun to share dishes), neither of us could turn down the fried chicken and bacon waffles.  Yes, you read that correctly, moist and flavorful fried boneless chicken and waffles with BACON COOKED INTO THEM.  Add the sweet but tangy cayenne syrup and this was to die for (literally, I was worried about my heart health afterwords).  The fresh squeezed OJ was good and my basil lemonade was refreshing. The Inspiration model of teaching students to run the kitchen is really great.  I am looking forward to going back for the meatloaf sandwich.

This place is rad! Not only is the menu diverse and the food tasty, but the staff is friendly and the organization behind the restaurant is great, too. Check it out if you're hungry and hangin in Garfield Park, for sure. Just be sure and keep your eyes peeled-it looks a bit like an office front from the outside-but the inside is fly.

The only place I EVER want to eat brunch! Seriously, the staff is always delightful, the food is incredible - really top notch quality and ingredients for the price, there is never a wait, and it's a really great institution.  I love the poached pear pancakes with ginger syrup and the chicken and waffles and shrimp and grits are both amazing takes on classic southern dishes. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

Wow! Great dining experience. I was invited by coworkers to this restaurant. You get fine dining with out breaking the bank. Great place for lunch. Will definietly return. They take credit cards. Make sure you take some cash for the tip since its used as a donation for community programs. Very nice restaurant.
Great place near the Garfield Park Conservatory.  Run by a not for profit, the food is excellent and it's all for a good cause. Nice dinning room.

Don't be put off by the "diverse" neighborhood of Garfield Park. Inspiration Kitchens has their own parking lot, and safety shouldn't be a concern. The proximity of the restaurant to the people they are helping only makes the good work they are doing that much more palpable.  I ordered the pork tenderloin with molasses glaze, served with collard greens and a baked sweet potato. At $12, this was the most expensive item on the menu, and I would have happily paid twice that based on the food quality. The pork was cooked with just a tinge of pink; the molasses glaze was yummy, filled with small strips of apple. The collards were delicious with an acidic bite, a flavor I've never quite tasted before in collard greens. And the sweet potato was baked, seasoned, and sectioned perfectly. The portions were great.  I cannot stress enough how good (fruity and sweet) the bruschetta was! Order it for your appetizer, and you wont be disappointed.

My husband and I are new arrivals to the Chicago area and are always on the lookout for new places to discover and enjoy in the area. We found out about Inspiration Kitchens in Garfield Park on Groupon and, since we are on a budget, decided to definitely check it out! We could not have been more pleased with the experience.  The wait staff (Jeffrey) was so friendly and welcoming with prompt service to boot. The atmosphere is very modern and clean with a homey feel. The menu looked very exciting with lots of different ingredients listed in the dishes. There is also lots of variety.  To begin, we ordered the bruschetta ($6) which was the most interesting bruschetta I've ever had--DELICIOUS! I ordered the Ancho Marinated Beef for my entrée ($12--the most expensive menu price). My taste buds were amazed. It was fantastic. For dessert we ordered the Peach Cobbler ($6) which was served in a festive mason jar--also very yummy. The food presentation was beautiful but not too flashy.  The best part was being able to have a world-class meal with my husband at such an amazingly reasonable price, even without the groupon! We will definitely return many many times more and bring friends and family.  The food was amazing, the service was great and the cause is wonderful. Please treat yourself to a wonderful meal at an unbeatable price and support a great organization.

We went for brunch...and while it's not near Lincoln Park, the 15 minute drive was way faster than our usual wait when we go to Yolk, etc. Though we had a reservation, we could have just dropped in since there wasn't a wait...(10 am) I had the PoBoy (with the chips) and it was a great pick! I also tried my wife's bacon waffles with cayenne syrup...that was also good, but I don't know if I would have enjoyed a full order...especially when I had my PoBoy in front of me and I was craving fish! The place is nicely done, clean, and there is even an additional family bathroom..."very ni-iiice..." So, why not 5 stars? Well, the food was really good, but not amazing...plus, the menu is rather limited...for this place to become a regular hangout, there would have to either more selection or a frequent update of their menu.  Since I definitely plan on returning, I will update my review and mention whether or not the menu changed...

We went here with a group of 6 and had a great time. The food was quite good--we tried all the appetizers and numerous entrees and they were all very good. The ambience is like that of a city loft with nice jazz playing. I had the free range chicken breast which came in a delicious ragu of white beans, artichokes and mushrooms--I spent 10 minutes enjoying that before I even touched the chicken, which was moist and flavorful. This place is a steal.
The best restaurant I've eaten at in a long time-the service was excellent- the go was superb . Make a reservation you'll LOVE it

I came here by chance, the mobile produce maket, Fresh Moves, parks outside their space on Fridays. I had heard good things, but was really impressed. We were treated well when we entered, but the star of the place was the food. My friend and I both got quinoa bugers. I was trying to lean toward the healthy side, so I ordered a salad, and the chips (a little good a little bad). The burger was amazing. It was very moist on a fresh bun, with little veggies cooked in, and seasoned perfectly. As a meat eater, I didn't miss the beef at all, which was totally surprising. The portion was very large, and I opted for an Eco-friendly doggie bag. I saw some other diners enjoy fried chicken and waffles, which looked delicious, as well as a tray of little cakes, which I had no extra calories for, unfortunately.  I enjoyed a mixed green salad with red wine vinegarette. The homeade chips were a great salty option on the side. My toddler enjoyed a large pb and banana sandwich with fresh fruit.  There are many reasons to visit Inspiration Kitchen, such as the green modern design, the composting garden, the window so you can watch the chefs, reasonable prices,  and good karma.  Mostly, you will enjoy good fresh food that is carefully prepared.

Fine Dining Urban Oasis. Organic Chicken, Locally grown vegetables  (20 feet from the front door) , Composting.  Here is a restaurant that is doing it right from top to bottom.  Every menu item is carefully constructed with purpose behind each ingredient. The Braised Pork Melts in your mouth. The Cayenne Agave Lemonade touches all the right spots on your tongue. The Bourbon soaked rice pudding makes a perfect appetizer or dessert. The staff shine with gratitude and make this more than just a restaurant, but a dining experience to share with friends in a wonderful setting overlooking Chicago's historic East Garfield Park. Inspiration Kitchens is a non for profit organization that trains men and women returning to life from the justice system. Providing free training in the Culinary Arts and job placement assistance, Inspiration Kitchens ignites the flame of cooking, and preparing food as art,  in the hearts of those that may need it the most.  TIP Well - all tips are donated to feed hungry families.

Ventured a bit (read: a lot) out of my Chicago neighborhood comfort zone tonight for a friend's birthday party at IK, and I'm glad I took on the adventure.  The physical space is sleek, the service attentive, and the mission noble.  Also hard to complain about the $20/person bill for a multi-course meal. Deducting one star for the gnocchi-- not a dish that should ever require a knife to eat, but nevertheless I hope to make it back here at some point.  Kudos.

This is Inspiration Kitchens' second location on the west side - Garfield Park area.  This is one of THE BEST RESTAURANTS in Chicago.  Located conveniently a block away from the Garfield Conservatory.  I can't say I have a favorite as I've had brunch here twice and dinner once.  The shrimp and grits is AWESOME!!  Also, the pork chop was so thick and tender you can cut it with a butter knife.  The ambiance is very intimate and green!  and the waitstaff is TOP NOTCH!
Everything I ate was amazing-including the basil lemonade! Service was excellent and super friendly. If you haven't gone, you really should.

This place had so much heart and soul - as well as flavor - that it is worthy of my very first Yelp review. The waitress was a peach from start to finish and gave meaningful advice when we asked for help choosing from the many delicious-sounding things on the menu. Crawfish beignets, spinach salad with goat cheese croquette, mushroom and shallot flatbread, and corn-crusted catfish hit every good spot on my mouth and beyond. The basil lemonade and apple cider tea were perfect compliments. Go here now. Just do yourself that favor.

Holy crap, you haven't gone here?  Go here. I have only been to IK for one brunch so far, but my experience was such that I am looking forward to my next visit.  It's like that. I opted for the shrimp and grits, and was beyond impressed.  The grits themselves were served in triangular blocks, but they easily yielded to my fork and melted in my mouth.  My coffee cup never got under half full.  The chefs are visible from the dining area, and all looked professional working on their craft.  The host was fabulous, and kept an eye on my friend and I throughout our visit. As mentioned in other reviews, tips go to the charity that is behind IK, so do bear that in mind.  This is a treasure of an establishment.

This was an all-around awesome brunch experience. I thought the service was great and more friendly than any restaurant I've been to lately. I found the menu to be concise, but diverse with tasty options for all. Plus, you can't be $8 entrees! It was quiet and cozy and I stand behind what they do 100%! Tips go back to the charity organization, so "pay up" as they say ;-)

This is a nice neighborhood place.  The food is priced reasonably for excellent ingredients and recipies.  Avril the manager has done a great job of reaching out to the community and trying to assure that real neighborhood people get to have a sample of their fares.  Good service, great food, happy atmosphere, green environment...neighborhood people finally have a nice place to go for a bite :-)

5 stars for the whole overall concept. I'm not the kind of dude that flings out 5 stars, but this is worthy. Love the food and the mission.   I've only done brunch, but each time I've ordered something I've been very happy. The price is right, the cause is noble, and the coffee strong. Chicken and Waffles are my favorite. It's not like a massive portion like you would get at Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, but it's nice portion and quite tasty.

Hello, secret brunch location!  Pairing Inspiration Kitchens with a trip to the Garfield Park Conservatory is a great way to have an affordable, but lovely afternoon. The modern, somewhat spare, but still inviting space wasn't terribly crowded when I walked in at noonish on a Saturday, but filled up as I waited for a slightly tardy friend.  Our server seemed like she thought I might be stood up, but was quick to offer a menu and a basil lemonade while I waited.  I was glad for the extra decision making time, because, though I'm usually decisive, I was torn.  Then I saw the chicken and waffles being delivered to another table, and my, and a neighboring table for that matter, decision was made. Some lovely boneless fried chicken pieces were accompanied by bacon studded waffles and a little creamer of cayenne syrup that was sweet and kicky.  I enjoyed every bite, the casual and friendly atmosphere, and the reasonable prices.  I also really love the role Inspiration Corporation plays in the community.  Unaware?  Check out their website, I'd hate to get it wrong, but as someone who is active in the labor movement, I love an organization that helps people with employment opportunities. I'll be back, particularly because I didn't feel like I should order both the chicken and waffles AND the short rib sandwich.  Such a little piglet.

I cannot possibly say enough good things about Inspiration Kitchens. Service? So responsive, great recommendations, incredibly friendly.  The food?  Fresh, local, tasty, and *so* interesting!  Ambiance? Charming, bright, with big windows for a great view of the park and an open kitchen.  Entrees were around $7-$8 each.  And don't get me started on the place's mission.  Even if they did nothing else, I'd consider them a charity, but they run food-service job-training programs for people in poverty to get them jobs.  And in place of gratuity, they ask you to donate to their charity org, which helps provide meals for working families.  They're also all about being green. I went with my boyfriend and another couple we know (we all promised to Yelp about it, so hi Mike and Karen!).  We were doing a little Saturday outing to the Garfield Park Conservatory and I'd seen on GPC's website that they recommend this place for brunch.  Anyway. Mike and I got this kicky gingery cider that was a big hit.  We all started off with the sweet-potato soup, which came with a cumin crema.  Such a light, interesting combo of flavors.  Then the entrees: Mike got a seafood salad (calamari, maybe?).  Karen and I split a stuffed French toast with orange syrup -- oh my god, that orange syrup -- and a butternut-squash omelet, WHAT?  Awesome.  My boyfriend got the catfish po' boy, which he totally loved.  Then for dessert we shared a sweet-potato bread pudding with peach compote and whipped cream.  We ranted together about how great it was -- not too sweet, but really flavorful and substantial.  Everything was so perfectly balanced. Cannot wait to go back.

My  husband, son, and I went to Inspiration Kitchens (Garfield Park) yesterday, and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the brunch. I had the butternut squash soup with the quinoa burger- yum; and my husband had "the best pulled pork sandwich that he's ever had". After brunch we packed our son into his stroller and walked over to the Garfield Park Conservatory for a walk through the flowers and a peek at the goldfish in the pond, which was a welcome change from the frigidly cold temperatures outside. Also, they are right on the green line and have plenty of parking, so it is an easy trip over there from the S. Loop.

Just got home from one of the best brunch/lunches EVER. Went to the Garfield Park conservatory to visit the newly opened rooms. A stop at this restaurant was a natural and perfect. (This is the first review I've ever written.) We were so nicely greeted when we walked into this quite attractive setting. Two tables were quickly put together for us.  Then the pleasure of reading through and selecting from the menu. With our questions answered, we were easily able to order. A special on today;s menu -- and it will be a permanent selection on the new menu going into effect next week -- is smoked potato soup. OHMYGOSH. Beautiful to see; lovely smell and flavor is SUPERIOR. Have never had something that tasted like this. FLAVORFUL. Delicious. Delectable. Divine. Would like to have a large bowl to savor. WOW.  We shared the lovely omelet with butternut squash, sage, white cheddar pesto, pepitas ...... S'wonderful. A nice cinnamon butter and good fruit preserve accompanied the sour dough toast. And one of our group enjoyed the pulled pork with very good "chips". I plan to make this my 'go-to' place.  Oh, you want to know how they smoke those potatoes?? Ask when you go for your own .....

I live in the neighborhood, so I'm very much interested in seeing local business succeed.  That said, I was predisposed to like Inspiration Kitchens and I have been pleasantly surprised each time I've gone.  Today though, I got the steak sandwich to go and it is absolutely amazing.  The chips were perfectly cooked and seasoned and the meat was juicy and tender and the fried leeks, gorgonzola, and slow roasted tomato were pitch perfect.  This might be a weekly habit...

Après le Grand Crisis déluge, we all will watch the East Garfield Park area emerge as the next great/artistically funky/green/racially-mixed neighborhood for Chicagos Rahm-olicious future. And Inspiration Kitchens will be part of it, no doubt. Its concept is great. Located a short walk from the GP Conservatory (easy access on Green Line), the well-lit space is warm and comfortable in its clean, industrial look. The staff is very friendly... and generous (they donate the tips you leave them  towards feeding needy families in the area, as our server explained that they are paid a decent wage). The brunch food I tried was very good, well presented, and not expensive. I recommend the eggs benedictine with green fried tomatoes and pulled pork. So be adventurous and give the near west side a try, it is the future...

Great meal.  The food was super reasonably priced and tasty.  Service was great.  No complaints.  And if its between a place you've been to before and Inspiration Kitchen go here cause is a small investment in your community.  Enjoy.

I loved the atmosphere, the service, the seats were comfortable, and the food was excellent. I had the half Chicken, swiss chard, and Chick peas for my entree. I had the house watermelon beverage and a sweet potato custard crumb cake for dessert ( so good you have to eat it in private).   My husband had Ancho marinated steak, grilled red onion, potato pave for his entree. My husband and I  had the same beverage and dessert. Fannie was our waitress and she was the best. (Superior service). Very clean facility inside and out. I can't wait to go again.

Inspiration Cafe is such a wonderful concept, with good food to boot!  From what I understand, IC enrolls low-income people with limited career options in a 13 week food service training program to give them the skills they need to obtain employment.  Our server, Fannie, was one of the best, most enthusiastic servers I've ever encountered at any restaurant - friendly, attentive, intelligent, full of suggestions, and she even made us her own signature drink concoction (a mix of basil lemonade and watermelon soda)  :)  Basically, what I'm saying is, I want Fannie to be my bff.   The restaurant is located just off the Conservatory stop and 2 blocks from the Garfield Park Conservatory - easy peasy to get to!  We came here on Sunday afternoon after a trip to the Conservatory.... We arrived about 1:30 and even though the restaurant closes at 2, they were happy to seat us and did not rush us at all.  The interior is industrial chic. I ordered the french toast with orange syrup, which was pretty standard, but tasty.  My friend had the catfish po' boy and thought it was a delicious interpretation of a po' boy.  Prices are very reasonable. A+ business!

The Quinoa burger was probably the best veggie burger I have ever had. It was definitely made with quality ingredients, a thick patty on a bun with delicious grilled tomatoes and greens.  The price was good at $8.  The decor was surprisingly good, beautifully designed, modern finishes, cloth napkins, quality silverware, and spotlessly clean.  It is a quite and peaceful setting, and has a healthy and appealing menu.   The service was ok, a bit slow and dispassionate until I complemented the food, then the interaction was very engaging.  At 12:30 on a Saturday the restaurant was about 1/3 full but there were no spots left in the small parking lot.  I parked nearby on the street, which is under the EL tracks.   I would definitely go again and bring others, especially if I was going to the Garfield Conservatory or Garfield Park, which is immediately across the street.  I would not wander into the residential neighborhood which is behind the restaurant.
Far exceeded expectations.  Professional, prompt and courteous staff. Good food,  well executed.

Only 4 stars because it was my first visit and I've only had breakfast. I can't wait to have lunch or dinner because breakfast was FAB-U-LOUS!!! I had turkey sausage (they make their own) and buttermilk pancakes with sliced pears and ginger/pear syrup! Woohoo! I'm all about GINGER with ANYTHING!  Others had the same or shrimp po'boy sandwiches.  We were celebrating a birthday and enjoyed BYOB as well. :D

Well, I hate to be the first negative review, but it is what it is. The service was negligent and while I waited for anyone to offer me a drink (8 minutes) I watched door sitting in the window for five of those minutes. Is my food going to sit there for that long? When we ordered appetizers and soups, we mentioned we might be hungry for more and the waitress told us they want the whole order at once! What if I don't want to do that? Tough luck? There's one waitress for 20 people and someone just standing at the host stand while food is sitting in the window. All that being said, the waitress was very knowledgable about the food, I overheard a customer ask about every dish and she was very educated so all problems to this point are organizational.  The bread that they serve comes with a colored butter that just tastes like butter which was disappointing. The bread was old. The oxtail empenadas were very good, a slight spice to the meat redeemed the underdone pastry. The dish wasn't consistent however, some being cooked more than others. The crawfish beignets were also very good, but the size of each varied to the degree that one was perfect, and the biggest was doughy. I then had the sweet potato soup and let me say that this was a grand slam, and cannot compliment it enough. The polenta fries however, were way to big to be fries and the bed of spinach that it was served on, actually had dirt on it.  All in all, I would go back if I was in the neighborhood, but I won't be making a special trip out there again. It is a great cause, but the food was subpar. I think if I caught them on a better day, then this review would be entirely different.

I have to admit bias since i work for IC and...it truly was an amazing dining experience. I ordered both the candied bacon waffles AND the shrimp and cheese grits (only order if you want to dream about them for days after!) and was so completely satisfied! Besides the great food the heart apparent at IK-GP makes me proud that these are my co-workers! Dine Well Do Good Indeed!!

The worst thing about this place is trying to narrow down your selection.  Luckily, I went with a group of 8 and I am not shy about trying things off of other peoples' plates.  We went for dinner, and everything was fantastic.  The portions were generous and the prices were reasonable.  They even have a little parking lot if you are worried about parking on the street.  Make sure to check their hours for the restaurant before you head over, as they are only open Wednesday lunch thru Sunday brunch due to training programs they host for the community and they warn that hours are subject to change.  This place is a gem for this neighborhood and will have a long wait time before you know it...

Fantastic meal, fantastic cause. I one point I looked down at my entree(pork loin- which was superb), and thought- 'if this was a fancy schmancy place they would divide this single portion into two entrees and double the price on each'. Inspiration Kitchens is a great way to enjoy a fine meal at an extremely reasonable price in a great atmosphere while supporting an important cause. Win-win-win. Check it out!

This place is going to be discovered soon. It's too good in terms of ambiance, service, and food to remain somewhat of a secret much longer. I've had lunch here twice with two different groups (a total of 32 people!) and each time it has pleased everyone. Go, enjoy, be able to say "I knew it when...". Be part of what hopefully will be an East Garfield renaissance.

This restaurant is gorgeous! And the food is really good too. I had my wedding shower here and my guests have not stopped raving about it. The crab cakes were delicious and everything was presented beautifully. Thanks Inspiration!

I had an excellent time here!  I had the ancho-marinated steak, which was just delicious.  As another commenter already mentioned, the wilted green salad that comes with several dinners was excellent - wilted just the right amount and not mushy at all.  The waitstaff was very friendly (maybe a little too much so - go and you'll know what i mean) and very nice about cleaning up our beers since we brought our own.  Highly recommend to anyone!

What a find! Eat well, do good, as they tell us here. The kitchen and waitstaff get job training, and the diners - us! - get amazing fresh hearty food, lovingly and meticulously prepared. The chicken is succulent, the greens are from the kitchen garden. No dessert tonight, but we'll be back.

What a winning combination:  delicious food, warm service, a room with a view, and a mission to warm your heart.  Bravo, Inspiration Kitchens!  I'll be back soon for more basil lemonade, shrimp & grits and cobbler!!
